subtitle: A great supper party dish that can be served with coleslaw.

method.text:
Line a 28 cm x 20cm Swiss roll tin with baking parchment. 
Preheat oven to 180°C.

Whisk egg yolks and seasoning until pale and thick. Fold in walnuts and cheese. Whisk egg whites until stiff. Using a large metal spoon fold egg whites into cheese mixture. Pour into prepared tin and smooth surface.
Bake for 25-35 min. Remove from oven, cover with clean, damp tea towel and leave to cool.

To make filling, melt butter in a pan and add flour to make a roux. Cook gently for 2 -3 min. Remove from heat and gradually blend in milk and fresh cream. Bring to the boil, stirring continuously, to make a thick, smooth sauce.
Season to taste. Add tarragon. Turn roulade onto a sheet of greaseproof paper and spread sauce over.
Arrange hard-boiled egg and asparagus on the sauce. Using the paper to help, roll up roulade like a Swiss roll. Transfer to baking sheet and heat at 200°C for 10-15 min.

title: Cheesy walnut roulade with asparagus
